title: Using loopcity
text: loopcity functions can used isolation, powerful used sequence. 4 main steps call communities .hic file GInteractions object loops.

title: Using loopcity
text: .txt file loop calls, can converted GInteractions object using package mariner. Loopcity requires loop anchors binned size, loops can also binned using assignToBins accepts loop file, BEDPE-formatted ‘data.frame’-like object, GInteractions object.
code: loopFile <- "../data/GM12878_10KbLoops.txt"  ## To read in loop file as-is, use `as_ginteractions` loops <- read.table(loopFile) |>     mariner::as_ginteractions()   ## To bin loops to a certain size, use `assignToBins` loops <- read.table(loopFile) |>     mariner::assignToBins(binSize = 10e3)

what: Step 1: Merge Loop Anchors using mergeAnchors
title: Using loopcity
text: Since loop calling can imprecise, using loop anchors -can lead multiple anchors representing one biologically relevant region. default, duplicate loops created via merging dropped, can kept setting dropDups = F. example, since one bin 10Kb pixelOverlap 1 default, loop anchors within 1 pixel 10Kb grouped merged one representative anchor. common middle-anchors chosen new representative position neighboring anchors. Increasing pixelOverlap n means loop anchors within n pixels, n * binSize base pairs merged one position. output, mergedLoops, GInteractions object information loops adjusted anchor positions.

title: Using loopcity
text: Since loop callers limited binary classification “loop” “loop”, can instead create possible loops create threshold kept “true” loop based set flexible parameters. first step process create set possible loops. connectLoopAnchors function creates new set loops, connecting anchors every anchor within overlapDist. example, anchors within 1Mb connected create new loops. results new GInteractions object, original metadata removed new metadata column named “source” interactions present original set loops labeled “original” added loops labeled “added”.

what: Step 3: Score original and new loops using scoreInteractions
title: Using loopcity
text: added original connections scored based enrichment counts loop pixel compared local background. shape size local background can customized using parameters bg shape, bgSize, bgGap, fgSize size. normalizes contact counts loop sizes, since shorter loops typically higher raw counts. account noise long range loops low counts, pseudocount value 5 added raw counts calculating enrichment score. pseudocount value can modified changing pseudo value. results new InteractionArray containing scores interactions metadata name .hic file counts came number pseudocounts added. get just GInteraction object new score column, can run interactions(scores)

what: Step 4: Assign anchors and loop communities using assignCommunities
title: Using loopcity
text: GInteractions object stored inside score can used assign communities. function builds network nodes loop anchor edge weights enrichment scores calculated previous step. default, loops score less median score original loops removed. threshold printed message stored metadata output object variable called pruningValue. value can manually set passing value pruneUnder parameter. network passed clustering algorithm. default algorithm leiden, options include “fast_greedy”, “walktrap”, “infomap”, “label_prop”, “edge_betweenness”. assigns loop anchor community, nodes closely bordering neighboring community evaluated determine included communities. average score border anchor anchors neighboring community greater average score interactions anchors current community, anchor assigned original neighboring community. Loops assigned community anchors loop community. see pruning value used remove edges network, run following code
code: communities <- assignCommunities(InteractionSet::interactions(scores)) #> Pruning added loops with a score less than 1.48611111111111 S4Vectors::metadata(communities)$pruningValue #> [1] 1.486111

title: Call Chromatin Communities From Hi-C Data
text: chromatin loops identified Hi-C data typically analyzed individually, growing evidence suggests often organize highly interconnected multi-loop communities coordinate gene regulation, yet existing methods detecting structures significant limitations including dependence imprecise loop callers requirements specialized sequencing techniques. Loopcity addresses gap R package designed identify multi-loop communities standard Hi-C chromatin interaction data, revealing higher-order patterns 3D genome organization beyond individual loops. loopcity takes Hi-C contact matrices existing loop calls input, constructs weighted interaction networks genomic anchors serve nodes loops edges. five-step pipeline involving anchor merging, loop connection detection, enrichment scoring, network pruning, community detection using clustering algorithms like Leiden, loopcity identifies densely interconnected groups genomic loci may coordinate gene regulation. package designed compatibility existing Bioconductor workflows includes visualization tools display detected communities within Hi-C contact maps, making valuable resource researchers investigating chromatin architecture, gene regulation, functional consequences 3D genome organization across different cell types organisms.
